How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What would you tell ali to do if he bumps into you when you are walking? Choices:  A: work hard B: slow down C: wear shoes D: sell products E: speed up<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input<n>#### A:  A: work harder.<n>#### B: B: slow down<n>#### C: C: wear shoes<n>#### D: D: sell products<n>#### <n>#### E: E: speed up.<n>####<n>#### B<n>Answer: C<n>### Explanation why<n>#### C<n>Answer: B<n>### Explanations why<n>#### B<n>Answer (same answer):<n>#### D<n>Answer: none<n>#### <n>####<n>####<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>#### D<n>Answer(same answer):<n>#### A<n>Answer:<n>#### A<n>Answer(same answer as first answer):<n>#### B<n>Answer(same answer again):<n>#### B<n><n>### Explanatory comments for:<n><n>#### C<n><n>#### D<n><n>#### No answer<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What do people do to pass time before they can use electronics when fly in airplane? Choices:  A: read B: passenger C: land plane D: fly the plane E: buy tickets<n><n>### Response:		Input:What do people do A: read C: land plane D E: fly the plane<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately replies to the questions.<n><n>### Rationales:A is incorrect because it is just plain reading.<n><n>### C is incorrect because it is not landing planes.<n><n>###D is incorrect because it is about piloting.<n><n>###E is incorrect because it is buying ticks.<n><n>### B does pass time so people do read while in airplanes.<n><n><n>### Input:"If you are trying to find the average rate of change for every single second for the height of a skyscraper that reaches 1000 feet in 30 minutes, calculate the height of it once every two minutes".<n><n>### Demnstration:"Let H(t) be the height after time t. We can't really directly plug in 1000 but it is still the same height just more frequent."<n><n>### Instrument:Answer the following multiple question.<n><n>##Instruction:A man named Tom has a penis that is two inches longer than average. How does his penis look based on the following statements:<n><n>### C 1: It is shorter than average<n><n>### C2: It is longer than average<n><n>##C3: It is longer than C3<n><n>##D: It is shorter than D<n><n>### Rationale:C1 is incorrect because when a man has a penis that two inches longer than average, that penis is not longer than average.<n><n>###C2 is incorrect because that penis is not shorter than average.<n><n><n>##C3 is incorrect because it does not matter.<n><n>### D is incorrect because it is shorter than D.<n><n><n>##Answer: C3<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What does moving cars entail? Choices:  A: driving B: road C: getting tired D: accidents E: ticket<n><n>### Response:		<n>What does moving cars entails. Answer:  D:accidents <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Input 1:<n>The value of any rational number p/q, where p and q are integers, is the value of q-p/q. So we can rewrite p/q as q-p/qq-p/q.<n><n>### Input2:<n>36 = 12.3612.36<n><n>### Demostration1:<n>The value q3 = 6q+36q+366q+36. Rearrange to get q-7 = 36-7qq-7=36-7q q-7 = 29q q 36. Rearranging again we get q =36/29 = 1.25q=36/29=1.25<n>The value of q = 1.2 q = 1.  Thus the value of 36/12.36 = 1.2 = 12/1.21.2.<n><n>### Calculation/Demonstration 2:<n>36 + 12 = 4836 = 1/2 = 3030 + 12 =31<n><n>### Calculate:<n>(36)*2 = 72<n><n>36+(12) = 48<n>36+1=47<n><n>### Demosrate:<n><n>The value of 30/2 = 15/3 = 5/3.<n><n>The value of (30+30) = 60<n><n>30-1 = 29<n><n>30 + 10 = 40<n><n>36=12.+36 =1.4<n><n>30 = 1/2<n><n>### Summarize:<n>The value of 1/2 =1.5

How much would he have paid without the price increase? <n><n>If James spend 200 * $1 = <<$200*1=200>>200 before the price increase<n>Rationales: James paid $240 * 2 = <<$240*2$=240>> after the price increase<n>#### ## Example #3: The Two Players<n><n>If 2 players scored an equal number if goals in a game against Barcas last season that accounted for 20% goals scored against Barcelona in the league, what was the number of goals scored by each player?<n><n>If we assume that 300 goals was the total number of goals in all games where a player scored an equal number of  with a teammate against barca.<n><n>Rationales - We have to plug in our numbers - If equal number of goals: each player scored 300/2=<<300/2=$150>>150<n><n>If assume that 20% of number of goals scored against barca:  We have to solve for number of goals scored against Barcelona:

How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Sarah thought that she had been home all evening.  That meant that the only time to leave was when? Choices:  A: early morning B: day time C: night D: afternoon E: daytime<n><n>### Response:		A: early morning<n><n>### Input->Output: Write a response such as the sample below that appropriately completes this instruction.<n><n>### Input<n>We sell 3 different brands of shampoo and I will let you know how many bottles of each we have in stock:<n>Clarins: 200<n>Natural Factors: 125<n>Phillip Kingsley: 55<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Which brand of shampoo sells the most?<n><n>### Input/Output:Write a response such as the one below that appropriately complements the instructions.<n><n>### Response<n>The brand that sells the most number of bottles is the Natural Factors.<n><n>### Output/Input :<n>You want to know how many pairs and how many jackets you have.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>There were a total number of 509 garments that your brother had as he had 20 different pairs of jeans and 5 different types of jackets.<n><n>### Reponse:<n>The number of pair and jackets you have is:<n><n>####<n><n>### Output<n><n>####<n><n>####<n><n><n>### Input -> Output:  Write a response that appropriates completes this task.<n><n>### You want to tell me about the car you drive.<n><n>### How Many: Write a response that appropriatly completes this task.Write a response that appropriatley completes this task. <n>* 0/1/2 cars<n>* 3/2/1 cars<n>* 12 cars<n><n>### Rationale:<n>If we had 0 cars then we have 1 car<n>If we had 1 car then it means that we have 1 car, 2 cars are 0<n>If we have only 2 cars, 1 car is 0 cars<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:The child really wanted to teach his grandpa to read, he thought it was wrong that he had spent his whole life what? Choices:  A: ignore B: write C: learn new things D: illiterate E: having fun<n><n>### Response:		E is wrong, because children should never ignore olders and learn new things from them to make the olders feel good.

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Where is a notebook often purchased? Choices:  A: bookstore B: backpack C: abraham lincoln's grave D: desktop E: classroom<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### 1<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:If you are driving too fast on an icy road you are being what? Choices:  A: deadly B: dangerous C: unconcerned D: stressful E: harder when weather bad<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately concludes the conversation. Add a closing remark and ask for his/her name (“Nice to meet you, Sally.”).<n><n>### Demographic Information: This is a 27 year old female with brown eyes and a size 6. She is standing overlooking the beach. It is the end of the day but people are still swimming around. She walks down the beach towards the water. She asks the nearest man if it is alright to go back to the lifeguard building.<n><n>### Input conversation:<n><div class = "message-area" ><n>Lifeguard Man:<n>Nice day to be swimming, right?<n>Female:<n>Yeah, yeah! It's so nice. I don't live here so I was wondering about the lifeguard building for swimming.<n>Lifeguard:<n>Oh you're a swimmer? Yeah sure, just walk on in there. But I'm not sure where the entrance is.<n>Female: (Laughing) Oh I see. OK, thank you.<n>Lifeguardin Man:<n>No problem. Have a nice day. (The end of the conversation)<n></div ><n><n>### Rationale<n>Female: Great.<n>Lifeguarde Man: Nice day to be swimming? (Repeat his previous sentences)<n>Female: Yeah, yeah! It is so nice out here! Hmm. Ummm. That's a good question. I don't know. Just curious myself.<n>I like to ask questions!<n>Lifeguard man: It's a nice day for swimming?<n>I'm not really sure where this lifeguard building is.<n>Lifeguardsman: (Says twice what I just said)<n>Lifeguards man: Yeah.<n>Lifeguart man: (Repeats what the female says)<n>OK, thanks (The end of the Conversation)<n></div >
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What has happened to a person's money after he or she has used the last of it? Choices:  A: dissipate B: flown C: disintegrate D: fall apart E: penultimate<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A: dissipate<n><n>```<n>33<n>```<n><n>---<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>Answer according to the rationales.<n><n>---<n><n>#### Input:Adam spends 4 hours a day listening to music and 3 hours a day watching TV. He also sits at the computer for 5 hours and reads for 2 hours. How many hours does Adam spend on electronic devices?<n>#### Rationales: He listens to music for 4/24=<<4/24=0.16>>0.16 hours a day<n>and he watches TV for 3/24=<<3/24=0,12>>0.12 hours a day<n>and additionally he sits at the computer and reads both for 5/24=<<5/24=0,.21>>0.21 hours a day<n>So altogether he spends 5/24+3/24+4/24+2/24=<<25/24+6/24+4/.24+1/24>5.6<n>#### 5.6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>---<n><n>-----------------------------<n><n>#### Input:Mike's brother is an athlete.  In his last race, he came in 6th.  If there were 57 other racers, how many people finished before Mike's brother?<n>#### Rational: If there were 58 racers, 57 finished before Mike's Brother<n>If there were 59, 58 finished before Mike's bro, etc.<n>There were 55 racers. His brother was in 6th place.<n>That means: 6 = <<6=3>>3 finished before him.<n>#### 3<n><n>Answer: 3<n><n>#### Input:If there were 79 students in math class at a certain point, where did 16 students go?<n>#### Rationals: There were 79 students. If this number minus that number was also less than or equal to 79,<n>then the number went down by 25.<n>Example: If 79 were 16 less than it was before, then that means that 79 - 25

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Where can you find a place to eat and places to buy items of many different kinds? Choices:  A: city B: downtown C: own house D: bar E: shopping center<n><n>### Response:		The place where you can find many places to buy and eat is a city or shopping center.<n><n>### Input<n>In a basketball game how many free throws can a player take in one quarter? If the free throw percentage for the quarter is 60%, what is the probability the player will make exactly 3 free throws?<n><n>### Response<n>The probability of getting exactly 3 free throws is $<3*0.60=.18>=18$%.<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a response that appropriately addresses the issue.<n><n>### A basketball player is trying to make exactly 5 free throws, but is having trouble making the last 2 after already making the first 3.  <n>What is the probability this player will make at least 4?<n>#### 0.823<n><n>### Instructon<n><n>Write a response that correctly calculates one of the tasks described below.<n><n>### Choose Two:<n>1. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:James drove his niece to her father.  Where did he drive? Choices:  A: great granddad's house B: family picture book C: brother's house D: family tree E: family reunion<n><n>### Response:		<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What could you buy in a bookstore? Choices:  A: carpeting B: magazines C: strip mall D: city E: applesauce<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Explain why your response is correct.<n><n>#### The first answer<n>If you pick "Applesauce", you could explain if you're being asked which you could buy in a bookstore, then you can't answer with a non-bookstore item. An applesauce bottle doesn't look like a book, and is probably used for food and not reading. <n><n>#### The second answer<n>If you pick any of the other answers (B or C), you could explain that they don't apply when looking for stores or malls to shop at, and are things to read. You should pick an item you could buy in a store. <n><n>#### Explaining your solution to the last answer<n>Explaining why you picked "Applesauce" is easy: you could buy bottled applesauce in a bookstore.<n>### Instruction Write the following code.<n><n>### Write: In Python 3 prompt >>>>. To exit a Python terminal, type "Control-D" (the "D" is a lowercase "d").<n><n>### Input 1: In a list l =[1,4,5,7,8] of 5 numbers, find the largest number.<n><n>### Answer 1:<n>```python<n>print(max(l))<n>```<n><n>### Input  2: Create a function called factorial() to take user input n and show the value of n! as n gets raised to the power of another integer. So 5! should show the value of 5 * 4 * 3 * 2 * 1 = 120.<n>		<n>### Answer 2:<n>```python<n>def factorial(n):<n>	if (n<=0):<n>		return<n>	factorial = num * factorial(n - 1)<n>	return<n>```<n><n>## Answer:480<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Some stores trick women to buy products, the sales make it seem like if you buy more you what? Choices:  A: get money B: pay money C: go shopping D: lose money E: save money<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Inputs:A farmer owns 650 chickens.The farmer hires a poultry plucker for only half a day.How many chickens will the poultry plucker take half a day to pluck?<n><n>### Response:"The farmer hires" means that poultry plucker is not employed by the farmer so hires means it is an external entity.<n>The work is done only half a day so the poultry plucking will be done half a day.<n><n>### Hence,The poultry plucker will pluck 650/2=<<325>>325 chickens in a day.<n>#### 325<n>Answer: 325<n><n>### Input:"An electric eel produces an average of 272 volts during a 2-hour time period. How much voltage is produced during that time period, to the nearest tenth of a volt?(Answer: <<272*2=544>>544 volt)<n><n>### Response:(2hours)=<<8hours>>=240min<n>60*240=<<60*24=1440>> 1440 sec<n><n>So (1440/272)=<<768/272=2.83>>2.83<n>Voltage=<<768*2.83=2131>>2131 volt<n>#### 2131<n>Answer: 2131

How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. Choices:  A: houses B: bedroom C: istanbul D: open tress E: gym<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the man put carpeting in his bedroom, then he most probably placed it in his bedroom, and he most probably placed it near his bedroom. So he most probably put carpeting near his bed.<n>#### Choice A<n>The man didn't really like getting out of bed on a cold tile. So he just decided to cover up with some blanket or maybe some pillows, and he just slept on the floor.<n><n>#### Choice B<n>Since the man didn't like to get out of his bed and step on a cold tile, he decided to place his carpeting in his house. So in his house, he placed it in his bed room.<n><n>#### C Choice<n>The man is most likely to have placed his carpeting in Istanbul. Istanbul is a city where the man lives at the moment and that was most probably the place where he put his carpeting.<n><n>#### Choices D & E<n>Whenever I wake up in the morning, I like to walk around my bedroom while listening to my playlist. This keeps me motivated and helps me get a good start. So, the man is also most likely to have put his carpeting in one of the room at his house. Because he likes to wake up and walk in his bedroom or the gym before he steps out.<n><n><n><n>

How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:People celebrate by going places and riding rides. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. What will the consumer do to maintain the same level of gas intake without altering their lifestyles?<n>The price of anything will be affected by the cost of production and supply. The price may also be influenced by an event like a shortage. Thus, if the cost of petrol to the consumers rises by say 10 dollars, consumers will purchase at the same quantity. A shortage may also cause the consumers to purchase less while the prices of the petrol will increase.  This will not alter their lifestyles but a shortage will be more likely.<n><n>### Inputs :<n><n>### Response :<n><n><n>### Democratation :  <n>The cost of living will increase the income of a individual who receives a certain incentive and wage in the public sector, which is based on the number of hours spent at the job. The increase is known as cost of living adjustment (COLA), and it compensates employees and pensioners if inflation and price levels rise as a direct result of the rise in living costs. This compensation is dependent on the number of hours the worker has spent at the job, which also means that if a person works for less hours, there is no compensation. In spite of the fact that the government has attempted to lower the prices of basic commodities by offering tax reliefs, this is a poor indication for the working class.<n><n><n>### Rationale :<n><n><n>## 6. If the price of milk doubled, how would that affect the quantity demanded in an economy where total income and preferences remain the same?<n><n>### Instuction :<n><n>### Input/Request:<n>The quantity of any good demanded will be affected by its price when other factors are assumed to remain unchanged.  This is because consumers adjust their consumption according their income and preferences to the fluctuation in price based on their preferences. Thus, milk is a necessity for people, which explains why there is high demand for milk, though the price has increased. Incre

If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What will happen if you are successful when committing suicide? Choices:  A: sew B: create art C: express yourself D: sing and dance E: write<n><n>### Response:		<n>- (C-D)<n><n>### Rationale: We will use the sentence:  We are lucky.<n>We make a noun in the sentence We by changing 'are lucky' to a plural.<n><n>![plural noun.png](images/plural-noun.png)<n><n>Now we have lucky as an noun and that means it requires a determiner, in this case I'm going to write 'a few' in front of 'lucky'. But 'Sing' is already an adjective, so we need to reword the sentence:  I have a bit of creativity and a few lucky get to sing.<n><n>![plura-adjective.png](images/sing-4.png)<n><n>Then we add the choice 'C':  express yourself.<n><n>Rationale 1:<n>We use a coordinating conjunction (For, And, Or, but) to connect words, clauses, or sentences (I ate a cheese sandwich and peanut butter. The answer is and.)<n><n>[link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iNYMvvTQ_Tk&ab_channel=MathswithMrsThornton)<n><n>![and.png](images/4_1_and.jpg)<n><n>### Input<n>The number of goals scored in each game this season will be 10%. less than the average scored at this stage last season.  If last season the average scored in the whole season against the same defending team was 2.4 goals per game, what will the average be this season?<n>RationalesIf:  The number of goals scored this season are 10% less than the same season last year<n>and: Last season, the averaged that scored in the whole season was 2.4<n>Then: We need to subtract 0.1 * 2.4 from 2.4<n>The equation is:<n>(1.0-0.1)*2.4=<<2.4*(1.0-0..1)=2.16, or 2.16* =2.16>>2.16 <n>So, the average this season should be:<n>2.16*7 + 340 =<<2.16*3=7
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Bob is in a dressing room.  He's putting on waterproof trunks and goggles.  What sort of facility is he most likely visiting? Choices:  A: swimming pool B: actors and actresses C: fancy restaurant. D: gym E: theatre<n><n>### Response:		Bob is most likely visiting a gym because the question doesn't specify which type of swim-ware he's putting on, but since he has to put on trunks and gogles, he's probably going swimming.<n><n>### Input;Choices: A: How tall is the building? B: What's the number of floors? C: What's the perimeter? D: Which year was the building built? E: How many residents are there?<n><n>### Response;C: What's the building's perimeter?<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the question below using complete sentences<n><n>### Response:(1)(2)(3)(4)<n>Answer:A B C 4456 D 440<n><n>### Instructors comment:<n>What was your first impression from the provided text?<n>What were your first impressions from the first set of questions?<n>After finishing the first set of questions, what was coming to mind?<n><n>### My first impression after reading the text was that it was about a job interview with a teacher but once I finished the second set of questions, I realized that it was about the school district's job search to get a replacement teacher which is a common job-hunting process to get a replacement<n><n><n><n>```python<n>def readFile(filePath):<n>    try:<n>        with open(filePath, 'rt') as fileHandle:<n>            return fileHandle.read()<n>    except FileNotFoundError:<n>        raise OSError("The file '%s' does not exist" \<n>        % filePath)<n><n>def readFileForChars(filePath):<n>        with open(str(filePath), 'rt') as fileHandler:<n>            return "".join(fileHandler.read().strip())<n>```<n>```python<n>def main():<n>    answer = ""<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:He was selling all his collector items even the rare plate, he had bought a lot at the what for the weekend? Choices:  A: supermarket B: kitchen cupboard C: table D: flea market E: dishwasher<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer for this particular question is: A and B are correct.<n>### Justifications:<n>A.<n>Since he was selling all his rare items, it should be supermarket.<n><n>B.<n>Since he was buying a lot at the supermarket for the weekend,  A and B are correct<n><n>C,D,E.<n>No answer<n><n>### Input<n>Tom had a choice of either 20% or 2% of his income. He was 2/3rds more likely to use 20% than 2%. Choices A, B, C are incorrect. Which one is correct?<n><n>### Response<n>No answers<n><n><n><n>### Input : The number of goals scored by a team against Barcelona in a match accounts for 1/4 of total goals scored in that match. If the team scores an equal number of goals as it does against its three nearest opponents, then how many goals does the team score against Barcelona?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The total goals scored against Barcelona is (14%/4).<n>Assuming the team scored the same amount against its closest 3 teams<n>Choose the closest opponent, then calculate the amount of goals scored against that team.<n><n>### Response : C.<n><n>### Justifications :<n>A,B and D are incorrect. Let B be the player who scored against Barcelona. A is incorrect as the total amount of goals scored against Barcelona is more than the combined amount of goals against the 3 nearest opponents (as we have assumed).<n>C is the closest opponent.<n>C divided by the amount of goals scored by C's nearest opponent is 1/4.<n>C + (14/4) = Barcelona<n>So Barcelona is 8 of the goal total scored against B's closest opponent.<n>8% of Barcelona is 8/140. 0.00618 is not an integer so answer must be rounded. So the answer is 8, which must include the decimal for correct answer.<n><n><n><n>## Solution<n># Task(1)<n>- How many hours does he spends  in gym?<n>    - 12/3 = 4 hours<n>- How much does he pay for fuel?<n>    - Total cost = ($4/2000)*100 = 2%

Choices:  A: selling out B: happy C: fishing D: receiving money E: getting paid<n><n>### Response:		<n>What is the author's opinion(s) or attitude toward the subject, and/or the speaker's <n>characterization of the subject, as opposed to a statement of fact?  (A: _B:_ C: _D:_ E: _)<n>#### A/B<n>Answer: (A: selling out B D: _)<n><n>Who is performing the action?  (A:  _B:_ C D: _E: _)<n>What event occurred?  (A: What B: is the C: happen the D: event E: has happening)<n>When did it occur?  (A: That B: when C: the D: so long after E: that long after)<n>To what result?  (A: Because B: as C: so D: like E: so)<n>Where did it occur?  (_A B:_ C D: E: _)<n>Choose the best description of the action from the list provided.  (A:_ B:_ <n>C D:_ E:_ F.G: _H:_) How many (A) _B_ <n>(C) _D_ (E) _F_ (G) (H) were there? <n>#### (A. ANSWER A)__ (B. ANSWER B) _(C. ANSWER C<n>__ (E. ANSWER E__ (F. ANSWER F)__ (G. ANSWER G<n>__ (H. ANSWER H)<n>Answers:<n>(A) Two<n>(B) Two<n>(C) Six<n>(D) Eight<n>(E) None<n>(F) Six<n>(G) Five

Choices:  A: countryside B: farming areas C: michigan D: texas E: north dakota<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is option E.<n><n>### Rationale: The options that don't fit are : A is wrong because it doesn't contain the word "glove" and doesn't have the word "or areas". B is wrong since it can't have a lot of fields as it is a city. C includes farms, but it was not the option.D has fields but the text also mentions it is shaped like a globe.<n><n>Input:  Two teams, Red and Yellow, participated in a game.  The total number of players in both teams was a multiple of 6.  If there were 4 players in Red and 7 players in Yellow and the players also had equal number of goals on the games, what were the number of players in both of these teams?<n>Rationales: Everyone had an equal number of goals that was a whole number, so 4 * 6 = 24. <n>Red had two fewer players, so the only way for that to work out is if the last player in Red had 1/6th more goals than the other players in Red, and the last player in Yellow had 1/6 of his goals as well.  That means that the last 4 were Red players and they had 24 less goals.<n>#### 24<n>Answer: 24<n><n>Input: Find the two digits, when the sum of the digits is reduced by 1.<n>Example: 19 + 1 = 18<n>Rationales: When we add 19 with 1, the sum we get is 20. If we reduce it by 1 the result is 19 which is 2 digits. <n>19 + 9 = 28<n>30 + 0 = 30<n>48 / 2 = 24<n><n>#### 24,12<n>Answer: 28,24,65,<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:If you harm property after starting a fire where are you likely to end up? Choices:  A: damage B: going to jail C: going to school D: burns E: destruction<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input(Demonstration):<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Input:- 3,2,1,1,1,0,0,1,1<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### The array of the above input is 91028100111,i.e it contain 2 digit,3 digit,4-digit,5-digit,6-digit……in order.<n><n>### How many different arrays can be generated in this manner?<n><n>### Ans:1<<9102871004164>>10^9<n><n>### Explain:<n><n>### This problem requires you to find the number of permutations, also known as the combinations, of all the possible arrangements of the nine items in the above array.<n><n>### Since there are ten places in the ten-digit array, and the first nine are occupied, permutations of the first nine are not possible, so each of the first nine items has a single arrangement (no permutation) to it. Thus, there are nine arrangements for that position. The last position has 10 spaces (not 9), so the last item will have 10 arrangements as well. There are a total of 10 * 9 = <<10*9=90>>90 permutations. You can write the above answer as 10 * 10 * 0 * 1 * 10 * (… * 10 * … * 10) * 0. For example, 10 * 5 * 4 * 3 * 2 * 1. (This is called iteratively multiplying by 0 because each time the power is reduced by 1.)<n><n>### Input :- 4,3,1,1<n>### Output:- 4,3,2,2<n>### Why?<n><n>### For calculating permutations, a starting number must be assigned to every place in the array. Thus, the first number represents the first place in the array, the second number represents the second place in the array, and so on. We can say that the first number will always go into the first place, and the second number (the second number) will go into the second place. If there are two

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What is a child likely to do while going to play? Choices:  A: laugh B: sit C: happiness D: being entertained E: walk slowly<n><n>### Response:		Answer B.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Explanation: <n>- As the input is the child is going to play so answer for C only are correct, A. is wrong because it doesn't make sense.<n>- The answer for both C and D is the same ie being entertained.<n><n>### Input:(A) A car costs $13,000 and is selling for $10,000.  (B) A couch costs $1,800 and is seling for $450.  (C) A computer costs $600 and selling for $400.  (D) A pair of shoes costs $60 and selling for 50 dollars."What percentage of each item is marked down this quarter?"<n>Rationales: <n>- A car price minus is selling price can be represented as 13000-10000=<<130000-13000=2000>>2000<n>- Now percentage of $10,090 is 2000/13000*100 =<<1300/1000*15/100=<<35%%>>35%<n>- Similarly, we can represent for price of couch and computer<n><n>- Finally, the pair of shoes price is 60/50 =<<60/50=1.2>>1.2<n>Then, the percentage is 1.2/60*100.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5%<n><n>### Input :<n>A number is given in the question, and a rational integer is asked to be added to the given number to get the greatest solution.<n><n>### Rationales :<n>1. The whole number (2n) in the divisors of n is added to the number.<n><n>1. For Example :  <n>   - Divisors of 4: 1, 2, 4<n>   Divisors of 8 : 1, 2,4,8    <n>   So the greatest solution can be 8<n><n>2. Here n = 11<n>    Divisors of 11:  2, 3, 6, 5,
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:where do you store wine? Choices:  A: attic B: basement C: art show D: church E: bar<n><n>### Response:		D<n>Input: You can get into the car if you bring your key.  The car key is where? Choices:  in the drawer, under the chair, inside the desk, in a folder at your house, in your shirt pocket, on a string around your wrist, in the car<n><n>### Respose:B<n>#### 1<n>Input:How many times do you do push ups every week? Choices:  once, a few times. three times, a lot, once every day, twice, never<n><n>### Respse:3<n>#### 3<n>Input:A store advertises their shoes to be 30% off.  If you buy 4 pairs of shoes for $100 each, how much did you spend?<n><n>### Response:760<n>### Input:You go to an all you can eat restaurant.  You spend the same amount on each dish, but you add some things to your diet.  How much did everything cost?<n><n>### Response 200<n><n>#### 464<n>### Instruction and Demonstration:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>Input:You have four boxes of 20 cans each.  You can only choose three boxes. How many cans of soda can you choose?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Cans of Soda: 20<n><n>### Rationales:<n>1) The cans of soda you can choose are 20 * 3 = <<20*3=60>>61.<n>2) There are 20 cans in four boxes.<n>3) 4 * 20 = <<4*20=80/50=160>>1600 cans of soda in four boxes.<n>4) 60 + 160 = <<60+160=220>>2800 cans of the soda in three<n><n>### Answer:<n>Cans of the Soda: <<160+60>> 220<n><n>##### Input:How much time do you spend using a computer in a day? Choices: under half an hour, a couple of hours, 3.5 hours, 45 minutes. 2 hours, more
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. The ________ method can give a reasonable approximation to that fraction.<n>A: central limit   B: average <n><n>C: median    D: mean <n><n>### Response <n><n>#### B<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The average is the ______ rule.<n>A: median   B: order  <n><n>C: mean  D: centrality <n><n>#### B <n><n>### Rationales:<n>The median is the ________ rule to help you determine if the answer is correct.  <n><n>A:central limit     B:mean <n><n>C:median  D:average   <n>#### B <n>
