How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:The person knew the police were after him, so what did he do? Choices:  A: the sun B: catch cold C: prepare to go D: feel humiliated E: hunt for food<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is : B<n><n>### Rationales:The correct answer is B.The person knew the police was at his home, therefore he prepared himself to go another shelter and he knew that for safety he should prepare the necessary ingredients, that is why he prepared to go.<n><n>### Input : How many more hours than minutes per week did he go to the gym? Choices: 3 more hours 3 more minutes 2 more hours 2 more minutes 1 more hour 1 more minute
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a bass clarinet to take home? Choices:  A: get hungry B: laughter C: injury D: having fun E: feeling happy<n><n>### Response:		D: having fun<n><n>```python<n>def find_hint(question):<n>    if(question.lower()=="a"):<n>        return "hungry"<n>    elif(question.lower()== "b"):<n>        return"laughter"<n>    elif(Question.lower()== "c"):<n>        return("injury")<n>    elif(Question == "d"):<n>        return(fun)<n>    elif(Question== "e"):<n>        return (happy) <n>    <n>```<n>

It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:A person with brown skin may share that skin with whom? Choices:  A: finger B: good health C: own family D: friends E: people<n><n>### Response:		 D<n><n>### Input:{<n>  "name" : "Blaise",<n>  "last name" : "Maguire",<n>  "title" : "Director",<n>  "age" : 52,<n>  "address" : {<n>    "street" : "Crowfoot Trail SW",<n>    "city" : "Calgary",<n>    "province" : "Alberta",<n>    "country" : "Canada",<n>  },<n>  "gender" : "male"<n>}<n><n>### Rationales:<n>A good response would have addressed the information in the JSON data that was provided and then the next step to do is to ask questions, the questions I would ask is if the employees' age is greater or less than 27? As for the email validation, I would probably use xss.<n><n>### Input:\{<n>  "name"         : "Blaise Maguire",<n>  "lastName"     : "Maguire"<n>}<n><n><n>  ### Rationales:A good response would have address the information in the JSON that was provided and then ask questions, the questions that I would ask is if Blaise's last name is greater or less than seven and if it is greater or less than two. After these questions are addressed then the next step would be to validate that Blaise's email is a proper email.I chose "A"<n><n>### Input:"Blaise Maguir"e<n><n>### Response:"A"<n><n>## Output:Answers to all questions<n><n>Output:<n><n>Answer: <n>The output for this answer is 56 because that is the answer for the question "How much did his purchases<n>cost?"<n>That's the same value that our solution would output.<n><n>### Output:<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Someone who is awake is likely to know what's going on because they are this? Choices:  A: winning B: entertainment C: happiness D: cheating E: relaxation<n><n>### Response:		<n>Enter A (winning) for answer.<n>Input:Maria gets $5 for a cup of hot dog. She also gets $8 whenever someone gives her $5. How much will she make in total?<n>Rationales She makes $5 + $8=$<<5+8=13>>13 when someone gives her $5<n>She also makes $8+8=$<<8+8=16>>16 when she gives someone $8<n>When Maria gives someone $5 and that person then gives her $8 she makes $8+5+8=$<<8*1+5+8=21>>21<n>So in total she makes 13 + 16 + 21 = <<13+16+21=50>>50<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration: <n>Input: I want to pay for the following: a jacket for $55, a pair of jeans for $67, a t-shirt for $19, and a satchel (bag) for $34. I paid the first two months ago. I have made $117 in a month so far this year. How much should I pay for the satchel?<n><n>Rationales:<n>Input: The jacket cost $45 + $55 = <<45.55=100>>100<n>Pair of jeans cost $67<n>T-shirt cost $19<n>Sachel cost $34<n>The total cost is ($45 + $67) + ($19 + $34) = <<54.19=73>>72.54<n>The total cost of item 1 is $45.55: that's $54.55 - $9.<n>#### 8.5<n>Answer: 8.5<n><n>Input: 64 ounches of milk costs $2.70 per gallon. Choices:  A: solidifying B: melting C: getting cold D: feeling cold E: skin rash<n><n>### Response:		Choice: E<n><n>### Response Explanation:The wet surface is causing a rash on the skin.<n><n>### Feedback: <n>##### B<n><n>## Response Explanation:Solidifying refers to hardening of an object.<n><n>### A<n><n>## Response Explannation:Melting is a process in which a substance changes from solid to liquid.<n><n>### C<n><n>## Response Explantion:<n>Getting cold refers to when the object is getting below its normal temperatuure.<n><n>### D<n><n>## Response Expletaion:<n>A feeling cold is a sensation of being cold.<n><n>### E<n><n>## Response Explain:<n>Rash means inflammation of the skin.<n><n>##### B<n>Rationales: Melting refers to when a substance changes from the solid form to liquid form. Solidify is when a substance changes to a more stable form than the present state.<n>Both of these terms cannot apply here because the ground is hard and not solid. Also both cannot apply here because if the ground were melted, then the ground is unstable and solidifying cannot apply here.<n><n>### F<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>#### 36<n>Answer: 36<n><n>#### 20<n>Answer: 20<n>Input: Your average weight lifts is 40 pounds. However, you’re really trying to build your endurance, so your workout this session requires fewer reps but heavier lifts.  On average you have to do one more rep of each lift than you did last time.  Based on your goal, how many pounds will you lift today?<n>Rationales:(The average of 1 and n is n/2)<n>If you lifts n/2 number of times of your 1st week for all exercises than you did last week.<n><n>Then in your 2nd week you lift n/2 + 1<n><n>(n/2 + 1 > 5, we only know your average lifts is 5 so we need to calculate n/2 + 4/2 to make sure it’s not less than 5)<n>So, you lift 27.5 pounds in your 2nd workout.<n>#### 27.5<n>Answer: 2

A restaurant is looking to remodel the kitchen and is deciding between two different contractors: A and B. A has 15% lower quoted price, but the lead-times on the project can potentially be 30% longer. The project is expected to use on average 1000 man-hours of labor, and the cost per man-hour is $50. Contractor A has higher profits, but can finish the project 50% faster. Which contractor should be chosen?<n>#### A<n><n>Rationales: Contractor A could be chosen. Contractor A’s price is 15% lower than B’s, and B is 30% slower. Overall, contractor A would take on an extra 30% of work. When contractor A completes the job in 30% less time, work is taken on on an extra 150% of the total work. For 30% more time, contractor B is paid 150% more. So it will take contractor A 50% fewer man-hours to complete the job.<n>That would save 50% in time, and that is an extra 15% of time. So if contractor A was paid $50 per hour for 150% total work, then contractor B would be paid $50 per total work * 150% time = $$50*150%=<<50*15/100=37.5>>37.5.<n>#### 37.5<n><n>2. How many marbles would it take to fill an empty glass jar if there are 5 marbles in the jar?<n>#### 40<n><n>3. If two containers have 250 ml of water in it and they each have a rectangular solid floating on the water with the dimensions 1/5 as long and 1/4 width as thick. If the surface area of the rectangular solid touches the water in the two containers, which container has more surface area in that state without the rectangular solid? <n>#### C<n>Rationales: In container A, with all the extra surface area the liquid would have to form

How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:what is the goal of going jogging? Choices:  A: heavy breathing B: feel pride C: getting tired D: lose weight E: run away<n><n>### Response:		answer: "C" because run is difficult<n><n>### rationale:<n>"C" because running away is difficult to run.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. What is her new account balance after the transaction?<n>##Rationales:<n>Adding 1,900.00 to 2,004.19 gives you $3,904.19. So she ends up with 3,904...<n><n>### 3,901.29<n>##Answer: 3,9001.29.<n><n>##Input:Nikki started a new part-time job making tacos.  He makes $8 an hour and worked 3 hours on Tuesday. If he made 25 tacos during his shift, what was his hourly output rate?<n>##Rationalizes:<n>$8*(3 + 25) = $<<8*(3+25)="8 * (3 + 25 )"="8 * 28"="224">224<n>##This problem wants you to calculate the rate per hour.<n>##$224/3 hrs = $<<224/3hrs="224/3"="74.667"="75">75<n>##Answer: 75 dollars an hour.<n><n>##Input:You plan to give your friend $30 toward the cost of a trip to see the solar eclipse. So, how long will it take at the rate you want for you to spend your $300 and you friend to spend her $150?<n><n>$$300/(25*p) + 150/(15*p) = p

Chicago is 2 hours behind Boston, so to convert 2:00 in Chicago to Boston, just subtract 2:30 from the time in Chicago.<n>2:00 - 2:30=<<2:30-2:00=0>>0 is equivalent to 0:00 and means that the time in Boston is still 1am. Boston is 3 hours ahead of Chicago, and Boston's time is still 1am, so the time in Boston stayed the same.<n>2:0pm - 2:3o=<<2:3o-2:00p=3>>3 is what your answer is.<n><n><n>### Demo:<n>Input: a = 2, b = 2, c = 10, d = 25, e = 40, f = 25, g = 100<n><n>#### 70<n>output:a =  b =  c =  d =  e =  f =  g =  the sum is 70<n><n>### Solution:A: 2 B: 2<n><n>### Demotest:<n>Input:  How many days are there in 80 years?<n>#### 31,200

If so, put it within a parenthetical.<n>"40 (Cubic Units) " in which the "X " is cubic units..<n><n>### How many cubic units you need?<n>45%-15% = 30% of the 100 cubic units = 30 cubic units<n><n>Therefore, 30 (30% of 100=30) cubic units are remaining.<n><n>### How much do have now?<n>The answer for the question " how much cubic units we have now?" is 40.<n><n>### What do you need from here on forward?<n>There is a remaining 30 cubic unit to complete the target of 100 cubiculit unit.<n><n>### Can you use the remaining to complete your work? If not, put this in a new box.<n><n>### 40 + 30 = 70<n><n>## Instructions:<n>You are to write a response that appropriately answers the question.

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What do you need to have before buying products? Choices:  A: desire B: spending money C: money D: needs E: time<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Write your response here<n>A<n><n><n><n><n>### Instructions: <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What happens when humans are exposed to noises? The world's largest building is the Pentagon Building which is in Washington, D.C.<n>#### 2 answer<n>The correct answer to the question, "Where is the tallest building on Earth located?" is Shanghai, China. For additional support, consider the fact that the tallest building on earth was built in China. Given the answers thus far, the second tallest building on earth would be the Burj Khalifa. Choices:  A: farmland B: neighborhood C: city D: property E: subdivision<n><n>### Response:		A: farmland<n><n>### Rationales: Furlong -> Yard conversion<n>1 yd = <<1/128th=6.8>>6.8 ft<n><n>1 yd => 0.5 ch<n><n>1 yd =0.334 ch<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write a step-by-step response with your explanation. The question wants you to choose one answer from the four possible choices.<n><n>Explanation:<n><n>Farmland could be considered tiny if the yard conversion is from the city to the countryside. Because a farmland is not near a city hence, it is not considered a city and the subdivision choice is also not applicable because the question is about the choice in which yard is tiny rather than the choice of which area is tiny. Therefore, I will choose the farmland answer from the list given.<n><n>### Rating:<n><n>### Evaluation:<n><n>Rationales: I am a rational guy.<n><n>###### End test

Choices:  A: theater B: computer C: opera D: television E: concert<n><n>### Response:		Which of the following statements describes where to find a paper program for a concert?<n><n>>C<n><n>### Rationale<n>> A: Theater - This answer does not match up for both the concert and theater.<n>> B: Computer - This answer does not describe concerts.<n>> D: Television - This answer does not mention concerts.<n>> E: Concert - This answer describes a concert event.<n><n>### Input : What did the ancient Greeks fear in the night? Choices: A: ghosts B: the dark C: thieves D: thunder E: witches<n><n>### Response :<n><n>>D<n><n>### Rationales :<n>>A- This answer is incorrect because night-related fears are not mentioned<n>>B- This answer is incorrect becuase nighttime fears and nighttime theater have nothing in common<n>>C- This answer is incorrect, becuase dark fears cannot occur inside the city, such as ghosts or thieves<n>>E- This answer is incorrect as nighttime fears are mentioned, but not night-related events<n><n>### Input<n>  How many inches are there for every foot?<n>-Five<n>-Four<n>-Three<n>-Two<n>-One<n>-None<n><n>### Rantale :<n><n>>None<n><n>### Inputs<n><n>>How long, in months, is the period of Great American Adventures?<n>-1 2 3 4 5<n><n>### Response<n><n>>Five<n><n>### Rants<n><n>>Each answer, but 1, 3, 4 are part of the Great American Adventures package, which lasts a total of 1, 2, 3, 5 months respectively.<n><n>### Answer : There are 5, 2, and 3 month great American adventures.<n><n>### Rantal<n><n>>There are no Adventure packs with 1, 4, or 5 months because none of those answers is a whole number.<n>>There is one adventure pack with 3 months because 3 is a whole number. There are two Adventure packs with a duration of 2 months, because 2 is also a whole number. <n>>There are three Adventure packs with one month, because 1. is a whole number<n><n>###
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What is a living thing with a lip? Choices:  A: mouth B: can C: human D: snake E: kentucky fried chicken<n><n>### Response:		Choose B- can or Choose D- snake<n><n>### Input<n><n> 24 = k<n> 52 = j<n><n>Choose j-52<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>18=r<n><n>### Input2<n><n>The total number of hours that Adam spends at the gym a year is 480 (because he goes to the gym three times a week for a total of 15 weeks).<n><n>What fraction of a year is spent working out?<n>Write a mathematical expression that simplifies to the fraction.<n><n><n>###  Rationales<n><n>(480/52)1/5<n><n>### Rationales2<n><n>18 months<n><n>### Question:<n>What does the number line in Rationales2 represent? (0,1,2,3,4,5)<n>A. It represents the amount of money Adam pays for nuts and dried fruits.<n>B. It represents the amount he saved by buying in bulk.<n>C. It represents the amount that is 20% of the original price.<n>D. It represents the amount to buy another tank of fuel.<n><n>### Answer: C<n><n>### Input3<n><n>What fraction of the game’s total goals was scored by two players?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>1/4<n><n>### Question2<n><n><n>## Input<n><n>John used to refuel for $200, the price went up 20%, now he pays $240 to refuel.<n>The number of tanks is doubled, and he pays $480 to refuel. What is the profit and the percentage profit compared to the original price?<n><n>### Calculating profit<n><n>$240 * 120 % = $$200 * 125 %$<n><n>### The profit was $20 = (240*120)%<n><n>### What percentage did John make off of the fuel?<n><n>125%<n>### Calculating the percentage of profit<n><n>(481/240)% = 0.1954%<n><n>### Rationale3<n><n>What is.1954% of 1000?<n><n>### Raisionales3<n><n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. They will practice by counting cubes with their left hand while they learn the process.  If they subtract 1 from a number, they should be able to count the objects 1 number lower. The total population of North America is about 10 times this amount. Can you help us figure out how many people live in North America?<n>Rationales"To multiply something by 10 you just make it a decimal and move the decimal point a space back<n><n>1000%10=<<1000%4=125 >>125<n><n>The remainder<n><n>Now make the number a decimal<n><n>So 125/10=<<125/1=12,5>>12,5<n><n>12,5

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. Choices:  A: upside down B: in motion C: active D: wakefulness E: resthold<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A B<n><n>Input: What is the median value of this data set? Note that no value is missing.<n>Rationales:"Median", as in the word middle, is the number that falls right in the middle.<n>So take the average of both numbers, 7 and 9- that number is 8, <n>Which is in the middle, and therefore the median!<n>#### 8<n>Answer: 7<n><n>What is the median value of the number below 6 7 8 9 10<n><n>"Median", as in word middle, is the numbers that falls in the middle of the two endpoints, in this case 6 and 10. Choices: <n><n>Answer: C<n><n>Rationales: <n><n>For rightward moving circles, the area increases<n><n>Input: A plane is flying from Atlanta to Washington DC and the cost of a plane ticket is typically 30% above the cost for a similar flight a month early. Find the cost of the ticket for a flight that's a month early.<n>Rationales :<n><n>The previous question was a multiple choice question. <n>The cost is a little bit hard to calculate but we can assume it's a multiple of $30.09. <n>Because every flight is 30% above a flight a month earlier, the previous flight costing $30.08 costs $40.29<n><n>So 40.29 costs the same as a flight a month early, but the flight a month early costs $30.00<n>So $30.01<n><n>So

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:John's RV needs electricity so that he can cook lunch.  Where would he go to plug in? Choices:  A: toy store B: basement C: school D: rest area E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>What is John’s RV’s full name?<n><n>#### Kids<n><n>Rationales: All John can do is plug into the rest area because A: The toy has his full name on it.<n><n>#### Middle School<n><n>Rationales<n><n>None of the options satisfy the requirements because A: The basement belongs to someone.<n>And B: The school belongs to someone.<n>C: The rest area belongs to someone.<n><n>#### High School<n><n>Rationalesa:<n><n>The electricity to plug in at the rest area comes from the school.  Because John has to plug his RV in to the school.<n><n>#### College<n><n>Rationalesa<n><n>It depends on<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What is not a safe way to transport jewelry on vacation? Choices:  A: suitcase B: department store C: safe deposit box D: these twos are not safe way to transport jewellery E: lady's boudoir<n><n>### Response:		You should take your jewelry to a safe deposit box at the local bank.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>A suitcase is the most common place for a pickpocket to look for valuables.<n>B department store is an easy place for pickpockets to work.<n>C for a safe that is available through the bank would be best in all circumstances.<n>D, 2, of these scenarios are not safe ways to transport jewelery.<n>E the ladies boudoir is not a safe way

Choices:  A: too much B: act dead C: die D: rush E: explode<n><n>### Response:		Input is: C<n><n>### Rationales: A implies B.<n>Choices:<n><n>Choices: If someone falls from a mountain then:  They are either dead or they are going to die.  If you are dead you are also dead.  If someone is going to die then they will die.  But if someone’s death cannot be predicted then they can only be rushed.  If someone is being rushed then they haven’t died, but are being rushed.  So someone who falls from a mountain will be either dead, will die, or will be rushed.  Since there is no option to fall from a mountain and die and rush is not a possibility on a mountain either.  Only options A or B may apply.  Thus the answer is choice B.<n><n>### Input Choices:<n>Input: If the value A-B >A-C-B+C, which of the following must be even? A: B<n>B: C<n>C: A<n>D: A+C<n><n>### Rationale: If C > B+B>A+C+A. Then C must be even.<n><n>####<n><n>####<n><n>### Input and response:Answers A and B. The value of the first digit, second digit, and third digit is 4;<n><n>Answer: D<n><n>### RATIONALS:<n>The answer must be a combination of A and B. However, C cannot be the correct answer because it has the second digit.<n><n>### Output of input:<n>Input: A 7kg apple, B 1kg apple, C 8kg apple<n><n>Answer: A+B<n><n>### RATENALES:<n>The weight is added, so A+B must be the answer.<n><n>### If 15x +20 =300, what do you multiply by15x?<n><n>### Answer: A*-20<n><n>An easy one! If the equation is 15x+20=300 then you are left over to solve:<n><n>$$(x/15)^2 - x -20 =0$$<n><n>Multiply by 15x:<n><n>$$15x^2-15x+2-20 =0$$

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:After new coke was discontinued what formula was used? Choices:  A: original B: old C: coke clear D: former E: familiar<n><n>### Response:		The formula used after new coke was discontinue was the original formula.<n>#### Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n>He had a 71-pound haub and a 113-pound hub.  The weights were in pounds.<n>He did 585 miles of work in two hours.<n><n>#### Response<n><n>This is a unit conversion problem.<n>To convert a number to a different base it can be done by dividing and adding.<n><n>The weight was originally in pounds.<n>Now it is converted to stones.<n><n>The unit of stone is equal to 14 pounds.<n><n>Now it is converted from stone to kilograms.<n><n>1 stone equal to 14 lb and we also have the equation 14/1 = 14<n>(this was explained at the beginning of the chapter)<n><n>So to convert the weight to kg just add the two equations<n>1 kg = (14/1) + (1) = 14 +1 = 15<n>14/14+1=1<n>221/22=1<n><n>So 221 kilograms is equal to 1 stone (pound).<n><n>Next we have to convert the 221 kg stone (one pound) into 782kg.<n>We can again just add a equation if 782kg = (221/1) + (782/221) = 221+36 = 257<n><n>So 257 is equal to 782kg<n><n>###Input<n>52 + 64 + 38 = Answer.<n><n>###Response<n>We have to follow these steps:<n>First add 64 to 38 to get 64+38 = 2<n>Second, add 64+2 = 66<n>Third, add 52 to 66 to get 52+66 = 118<n>Final answer: 118

It is equal to the area of a square whose side is one meter. If 2 meters squared is how much smaller is 8 meters squared than a square kilometers?<n>Rationales 1 meter squared = <<1= 1>>1 m2<n>So when we multiply 2 by 2 we get <<2*2=4>>4 m2<n><n>8<n>So a square kilometer is <<8=1.15km^2>>1.15 km^2 larger than 2m2<n>#### 49<n>Answer: 49<n><n>### Instructio: Answer the following short response question.<n><n>## Instructions:  Answer each of the following multiple-choice questions.<n><n>## Response:<n><n>A multiple-choice question will have several answers to choose from. Select one of these choices. There will be one correct answer and four incorrect answers that will be distractors or red herrings. (If you use these resources correctly, you will identify the one right answer and the four wrong answers.) We are looking to understand how to correctly answer a multiple choice question. So for this multiple choice question we need to make sure we choose the correct answer
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:My favorite type of entertainment are rollercoasters and ferris wheels, where should I go? Choices:  A: theatre B: fairgrounds C: friend's house D: show E: casino<n><n>### Response:		Which activity can you perform with the most people?<n><n>### Answer: A: theatre<n><n>### Rationale:<n>I would not go to a Casino, because of privacy. I would not go to a show because it's too one dimensional. I also think it's too noisy as well. I don't do fairgrounds, because of being on a Ferriswheel. I don't like to talk to a lot people so my favorite type of entertainment would be the theater.

If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:One way to relieve your hunger if you live near the coast is to do what? Choices:  A: grill B: go to market C: bring home fish D: eat hamburger E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		Answer "A"<n><n>### Rationale:In my opinion A is the correct answer.  "grill" and "go to market" do not tell that what kind of food we have.<n><n>### Input:"A", the input above, equals A.<n><n>### Response:"D", the response above, equals D.<n><n>### Answer: C<n><n>### Inputs:11<n>#### 7<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Input:'C',the input above, equals B.<n><n>### Questions:1<n><n>### Question:"Why is 'a' wrong?"<n><n>### Answer:"a" equals B, the 6th letter in the 3rd position.  <n><n>### So, "a" is the wrong answer.  The right answer is "b".<n><n>### Question:2<n><n>### Question:/Question:"Why is 'b' wrong?"<n><n># 输入: A question that asks you to solve a problem. The answer should be a statement.<n><n>### The answer we will find first is "b".<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>### After that, we will find the answer will be "c".<n>```<n>'b' * 10 = <<"b"*10=6>>6<n>'c' * 10 - 1 = <<"c"*10-1=5>>5 <n>'c' * (10 - 1) - 1 = <<(<<"c"*1(10-1)=5>>5)*1(10-3)= 4>>4<n><n>```<n>Because "b" <= "c"<n>```<n>'c' * b = <<"c"*"b="<<"c"*b="5">>5>><n>'c' * c = <<"c"+"c"="<<"c"+"c="<<"c"+("c"*c)=<<"c"*c=7>>7>><n>```<n>So, "c" is the right answer.<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input="7",the input above, equals D, the fifth letter in the fourth position.<n><n>### Rewritten Question:1<n><n>##input: "A"/"'B'"
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:The shelf was showing signs of instability, what should the carpenter fix to avoid any issues? Choices:  A: villa B: spacecraft C: hall D: palace E: hotel<n><n>### Response:		 It's a small cabin.<n><n>### Input:{ "x":7, "typeA":2"typeB":1, "typeC":5, "typeD":4, "typeE":9}<n><n>### Response:{ "typeA":2, "typeB":1,  "typeC":5,"typeD":4,  "typeE":9 }<n><n>### Instructions: Given a list of integers and a key, determine whether each integer is a subkey of the key. An integer is a subkey if it could be used to create the key by only using a certain number of 0’s or 1’s between each integer so long as the number of 0’ and 1’s is equal to the integer’s length. For example, 9 is a subkey of 7, 2, 26 as 7=9=2.<n><n>### Example Input: ["3", "3", "3", 5, 3]<n><n>### Example Output: [[2, 2, 8, 9], [11], [1]]<n><n>### Constraints:<n><n>- All of integer types with values between [0..100000]<n>- Integer will be no more than 1,000<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>- "2", 6,  9<n>	<n>- "3"<n>	<n>- "5"<n>	<n>- 2, 4, 16<n>	<n>- "7"<n><n>|key|subkeys|<n>|:------- |: |<n>|2|[6,9]|<n>|3|[]|<n>|5|[2,16]|<n>|7|[]|<n>|10000|[]|<n><n>### Input:[1,2,3,4,5]<n><n>### Instctions:<n>Given N primes, determine if N is a composite number. A number is composite if it can be factored into smaller primes. If so, return a list of the prime factors of the number.<n><n>### Examples: Input:[1,2] output: "false"<n><n>### Explanation: <n><n>Input:[2,3] output: "true", factors: [2, 3]

Choices: 1 2 3 4 5<n><n>Input:A cashier is taking payment from a customer.<n>How many digits in the largestdenomination  <n>the customer can use?<n>The cashier is taking the payment from a customer meaning that, the largest denomination of a currency note is required.<n><n>Example: To take cash of Rs. 500, a customer can pay using 200 and 100 note but not using 10 note.<n><n>The smallest denomination of note used is 10.<n><n>A customer can use maximum of 5 times 10 which is 50.<n><n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input<n>What is the total number of different possible solutions to the following problem?<n><n>Input: To get to school, Sarah must make a turn, followed by five straight road segments. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:What business has a tower to transmit signals? Choices:  A: city B: toronto C: radio station D: roger that E: medieval castle<n><n>### Response:		Choice A, Toronto Star<n><n>### Justify: The choice that can be explained with the given question is Toronto Star.<n><n>Input:What happens when you mix vinegar and baking soda? Choices: 1: baking soda and vinegar will combine to form a chemical reaction. 2: When these chemicals are put in separate containers they will create a reaction. 3: Baking soda and vinigar can combine chemicall to produce a violent reaction. 4: Vingar and baking sods produce an explosion.<n><n>### Response A, Choice: 3<n><n>### JustifI am: The given example shows the best answer that combines the two chemicals, which is the choice I believe.<n><n> Input: <n><n> 1) Adam bought 3 kilogram of nuts and <n> 2.5 kilogram of dried fruits in it. <n> How much did his<n> 3) purchase?<n> Rationales: <n> He spent $12 for 3 kilogram of<n> 4) nuts<n><n> He spent $8 for 2.5 kilo of dried<n> 5) fruits<n> So in total he spent<n> 6) $36 + $<n> 7) 20 = $56<n><n> ##Instruction:<n> 8) Which is a part of a 5-digit number that is 6 away from the second digit?<n> Choices: 8 and 2. 9 and 4.10 and 5.11 and 6<n><n> #9: 11=7<n><n><n> ##Instruction<n> 9) What is the largest prime number that is a multiple of 12?<n> Choices:<n> 1: 45<n> 2: 54<n> 3: 63<n> 4: 90<n> 5: 112<n> 6: 135<n> 7: None of theses are correct<n><n> #9: I don't know<n><n><n> ##Instructions:<n> 10) Choose the word that is spelled correctly.<n> Choices:<n> A: lest<n> B: test<n> C: list<n> D: least<n> <n> D<n> ##<n><n> 11)Choose the word that is correctly plural

Please pick from the choices shown below.<n><n>Which one of these statements is false? <n><n>### Input<n><n>The function f(x)=x*x+2<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>I think statement C is false. This statement states that any value for x that is less than 2 is equal to 0. I think a value less than 2 will not be zero. It will be a positive or negative number that is less than 0. When x is multiplied by itself we will end up with the value 1.<n>To be fair to the student who wrote this, the last sentence should read "I think statement C is FALSE because..."<n><n>### Input 2:<n><n>> Which of these statements is true?<n>><n>> <n><n>> A group of elephants is in a line. In this scenario the asker is trying me to determine how one might test to see if the answer to the question is "true". The answer is not really a 'question' but rather an open ended phrase meant to get me to ponder the question. How many draw cycles does it require to drain a 13.7 foot tank?<n>**Input:** A 45 gallon pump at 3 feet draws 4.9 gallions and it needs 13.7 ft tank.<n>```<n><n>**Rationales:** The height is equal to one cycle. So, the total cycles required is 13.7/4.9=3.<n>```<n><n>

How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Where would you store a shopping bag if all the seats in your vehicle are full? Choices:  A: the roof B: storage cabinet C: car trunk D: retail store E: home<n><n>### Response:		Write a response that appropriates completes the request. Write your response in the Response box.<n><n>### Answer: A<n><n>### Rationale:A: The roof is the most logical choice since he already has to be holding the shopping bag.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:When you are expressing yourself by yelling after getting a bruise, what are you feeling? Choices:  A: self pity B: communication C: understood D: pain E: embarrassment<n><n>### Response:		<n>D: pain<n><n>### Instructions:When you are express yourself after getting a bruise by yelling, you could be communicating your feelings, but you could also be feeling embarrassed.<n><n>### Input 2:When you are express when you are express yourself by yelling, what are you feeling Choices:  A B C D<n><n>### Rationales:The only ones that don't involve the option of feeling embarrassed are communicating and understood. Choices: A) never B) 10 times per year C) 1 time D) 10 times E) every day ##Instruction:Choose the most appropriate option to respond to the input.<n>### Demonstraition:  I have been bitten by spiders 55 times in the last 5 years.<n>### Rationales:  I was bitten by spiders every 10 days  in the last 5 yeas<n>### I was bitten by a spider 8 times in the first year<n>### I was bitted by spiders every 20 days for the last 5 years<n>### I was not bitten by spiders in the last 2 years<n>### I have still never been bitten by a spiders<n>#### 120<n>Answer: D<n>### Input:For a company, 50% of the number of employees who receive bonuses and only 25% of the number of executives receive bonuses each year. Choices:  A: let down B: respect C: illness D: satisfaction E: gratitude<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rationales: Let Down: he lost 10 pounds to his brother Became Ill: his father had a heart attack.<n>He also saved a persons life (he was about to fall on train tracks when he told the man not to cross the tracks). Responded well when a few people at work quit.<n><n>####  Answer:<n>A<n><n>### Input<n>He used a ruler to measure the circumference of the moon and found it to be 7,200 miles.  He had a bucket with a three-foot handle, and so he decided he could carry the bucket up 3 feet of rope on his back, and then he would make 3 trips up and over the hill at a rate of 2 trips per hour. How much rope would he have left over?<n><n>### Response<n>Rationales: Lets call the length of the rope A, We are given that the length we need to carry on our back is A-3, This works out to be 23 feet.  So we have 3x7,200 in miles.  So he needs 21,600  miles to carry the rope and bucket.  The number of miles he needs to carry over the mountains would be A-23.  Lets just simplify that to A-23, so he needs A-23 miles more to complete the task.  So he needs A+23.  But the number he is given is 3,235, miles.  Lets call this B,  So A+B=>>3235+...>>A+B=5,435, So 5,435 is greater than 6015.  So thats our answer.<n><n>#### 6015<n>Answer: 6015

It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:James was cooking s stew in his apartment kitchen.  Where might he look for a potato. Choices:  A: restaurants B: casserole C: root cellar D: pockets E: pantry<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Justification<n>16 o/clock was not appropriate.<n>D.<n><n>### Input : John wants to start a food delivery service.  First he needs to start advertising.  He uses the most ads during the midafternoon.  Where should John start his advertising to best maximize his sales within 60 minutes?<n><n>### Response :<n>10.a.m.<n><n>### Justifications<n>First of all because it is not like<n><n>Second and foremost because I feel that ten.a.m. is the best possible.<n><n>### <n><n><n><n># <b>6.<n><n>### Task Instruction:  Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Display: <n>A man paid $30 and $60 for two different boxes of 50 cereal bars.  How much did he spend on the cereal?<n>Explanation: <n>100.00<n><n>How much did he pay for each box?<n>Answers: <n>$30 * 5 = <<30*5=150>>150<n><n>$60 * 2 = <<60*2=120>>120<n><n>$30 +$60=<<30 +60=90>>90<n><n>$150 + $120=<<150+120=270>>270<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:The sun was out and the temperature changing rapidly, it was really beginning to what? Choices:  A: drop to zero B: increase C: cool down D: dropping quickly E: heat up<n><n>### Response:		<n>It was not decreasing.<n><n>[Answer](<https://www.groupon.com/local/shopping/sellers/deals/sales/194866280/june-2014-week/30564881/sales-and-promotions?affid=20>)<n><n>[Link to Question](https://webmaths.info/forum/threads/task-156-answer-the-following-4-multiple-choice-questions.106/post-62477)<n><n>[Link to Solution](https://webmathsinf.io/forum/threads/answer-the-followin%22) <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input: James has to refuel his plane.  It used to cost $200 to refill the tank.  He got an extra tank to double fuel capacity.  Fuel prices also went up by 20%.  How much does he pay now for fuel?<n>Rationales: The cost to fill a tank went up 200*.2=$<<200*.2=40>>40<n>So it cost 200+40=$<<200+40=240>>240 to fill the tank<n>That means he now pays 240*2=$<<240*2=480>>480<n>#### 480<n>Answer: 480<n><n>Input: The number of goals scored in a game against Barca by exactly two players last season accounts for 20% of all goals scored in the league. If the players scored an equal number of goals, and the total number of goals scored in the league against Barca that season is 300, calculate the number of goals each of the two players scored.<n>Rationales: If the total number of goals scored in the league that season against Barca is 300, the two players scored 20/100*300=<<300*20/100=60>>60 goals.<n>If the players scored an equal number of goals, each scored 60/2=<<60/2=30>>30 goals.<n>#### 30<n>Answer: 30<n><n>Input: Every day Tom drinks 5 12-oz cans of soda plus 64 ounces of water. How many ounces of fluid does he drink a week?<n>Rationales: He drinks 12 * 5 = <<12*5=60>>60 ounces of soda a day<n>So he drinks 60 + 64 = <<60+64=124>>124 ounces of liquid a day<n>So in total he drinks 124 * 7 = <<124*7=868>>868 ounces of liquid a week<n>#### 868<n>Answer: 868<n><n>### Input:Where did his wife ask him to look first when he complained of missing deodorant? Choices:  A: grocery store B: nightstand C: armpits D: own bathroom E: medicine chest<n><n>### Response:		D is correct because she asked me where is the most likely place for it to have been left.<n><n><n>

If you use for loop count will increase like 2,4,6 then use while loop. It takes time to execute it.<n><n>var sum = 0;<n>//array= [4, 8, 14, 23]<n>//for (var i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {<n>//    console.log("Index", i);<n>//    sum = sum + array[i];<n>//}<n><n>var array = [4, 8];<n><n>while(true) {<n><n>        sum += array[0];<n>        array = array.slice(1);<n><n>        console.log("Sliced", array.length);<n><n>        if(array.length == 0) {<n>            break;<n>        }<n>}<n><n>console;log(sum);<n>
